_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Executive Summary - North Central Cooperative - Clarion Facility


Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response Policies:
 This facility complies with regulated anhydrous ammoina requirementsand it is our ploicy to adhere to all 
 applicable federal, state and local laws. If an emergency were to occur, it is our ploicy to notify the 
 Clarion Fire Department and request that they respond to the emergency.

Description of Facility:
 This facility is a retail farm supplier. We sell anhydrous ammonia to farmers for the purpose of crop
 production. On site we have a 30,000 gallon and a 26, 000 gallon storage tank for anhydrous ammonia.
 These storage tanks are filled to a maximum of 85% of capacity to allow for product expansion.

Worst Case Release Scenario:
 Our worst case scenario is a gas release from one of our staore tanks. According to EPA"s RMP Comp, 
 the distance to endpoint is 3.2 miles. There are residences, schools, a hospital, nursing home, recreation 
 area and a jail within the distance to endpoint with a total of 552 people affected.

Alternative Release Scenario:
Our alternative release scenario is a transfer hose failure. According to EPA's RMP Comp, the distance to endpoint is 0.20 miles There are residences within the distance to end point with a total of one person affected.

This facility has excess flow valves and emergency shutoffs in place to minimize the chances of an accident occuring. All personnel are trained annually in the safe operation of the equipment and facility. We have also installed concrete barriers in traffic pattern areas in an effort to elimanate any damage from a a vehicular accident. 

General Accident Release Prevention Program and Chemical Specific Prevention Steps:
 This facility complies with EPA's accident prevention rule and all applicable federal, state and local codes
 and regulations. This facility is annually inspected by in-house personnel and by the Iowa Department 
 of Agriculture.

Five-Year Accident History:
 We have never had an accident involving anhydrous ammoniathat caused death, injuries, property or 
 environmental damage, evacuations or shelterings in place.

Emergency Response Program:
 In the event of an emergency involving our anhydrous ammonia facility, it is our policy to notify the Clarion Fire Department and request that they respond to the emergency. We have discussed this policy with the 
 fire department. Members of the fire department have inspected our anhydrous ammonia facility.

Planned Changes to Improve Safety:
 None Agriculture.
